name: Movavi
overview:
Established in 2004, Movavi is a developer of multimedia processing software focused on resolving compatibility issues between video and audio formats and devices. Movavi also offers B2C and B2B cloud-based video and audio conversion services using the Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) business model.

Movavi offers digital media software products for Windows and Mac OS. The best-seller products are Movavi Video Converter and Movavi Video Suite.

Movavi flagship online service is Aviberry.com â€“ a cloud-based video and audio encoding service designed for small to large-scale multimedia content providers. The service is based on Movaviâ€™s proprietary multimedia conversion technology, which the company has adapted for the cloud, enabling service capacity to be scaled up in very little time.

Movavi supports the following partner technologies to boost video processing efficiency: IntelÂ® Hyper-threading technology, IntelÂ® HD Graphics technology, NIDIAÂ® CUDAâ„¢ and NIDIAÂ® CUDAâ„¢ Multi-GPU technologies.

Over 9 million people in 95 countries use Movavi products for their video and audio processing needs.

The company products are available in ten languages â€“ English, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, Spanish, Polish and Russian.

Partners include Intel, NVIDIA, and more.
